description: Added some fields for FLASH that were in the 3.0 repo.
title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.html: Is "ye" the electron fraction? If so, it shouldn't have units.

content.raw: Also, just wanted to check--is this really Joules/cm^3 and Joules? They don't match up with the normal cgs units, and especially the mixed use of MKS and cgs seems odd.
content.html: Also, just wanted to check--is this really Joules/cm^3 and Joules? They don't match up with the normal cgs units, and especially the mixed use of MKS and cgs seems odd.

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw: I suspect here that instead of multiplying by Avogadro's number that we should import mp from the physical_constants module and divide by it.
content.html: I suspect here that instead of multiplying by Avogadro's number that we should import mp from the physical_constants module and divide by it.

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw: This is exactly the equation given in the FLASH user's guide for these fields.  It looks this way because of the somewhat wacky way that ye is defined.
content.html: This is exactly the equation given in the FLASH user's guide for these fields. It looks this way because of the somewhat wacky way that ye is defined.

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw: It is more consistent with other FLASH names.  If you want we can alias 'VelocityMagnitude' with 'velo'
content.html: It is more consistent with other FLASH names. If you want we can alias 'VelocityMagnitude' with 'velo'

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw: 1 / mp is the wrong value.  Adding Avogadro's number to physical_constants would be more correct.
content.html: 1 / mp is the wrong value. Adding Avogadro's number to physical_constants would be more correct.

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw:
Yes, this is the unfortunate side effect of the fact that FLASH's use of Avogadro's number vs. the proton mass is in conflict with the convention taken by most other astrophysics codes, which normally use the proton mass when converting between mass densities and number densities. The difference is < 1%, so it kind of depends on whose definition of "wrong value" you accept here. 

But, since FLASH uses this value, I think it's probably fair to say we use it in this frontend, so I think copying the value of N_A from the FLASH code constants database and adding it to yt.utilities.physical_constants is the best way to go.
content.html:
Yes, this is the unfortunate side effect of the fact that FLASH's use of Avogadro's number vs. the proton mass is in conflict with the convention taken by most other astrophysics codes, which normally use the proton mass when converting between mass densities and number densities. The difference is < 1%, so it kind of depends on whose definition of "wrong value" you accept here.

But, since FLASH uses this value, I think it's probably fair to say we use it in this frontend, so I think copying the value of N_A from the FLASH code constants database and adding it to yt.utilities.physical_constants is the best way to go.

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw: So I don't muck up the particulars, what *exactly* do you want the Avogadro's number variable to be named?
content.html: So I don't muck up the particulars, what exactly do you want the Avogadro's number variable to be named?

pullrequest.title: back ported flash fields from yt-3.0

content.raw: Maybe just "Na"? Also, it looks like you should just be able to define it as 1/amu_cgs, which is already defined in there. That's what I should have said instead of mp.
content.html: Maybe just "Na"? Also, it looks like you should just be able to define it as 1/amu_cgs, which is already defined in there. That's what I should have said instead of mp.

content.raw: Done.  I hope this is enough.
